description: Dirichlet convolution of number-of-divisors function (A000005) with A007426.
comments: a(n) is also tau_6 (the 6th Piltz divisor function), where tau_5 is A061200, and A000005 is tau_2 (= tau).a(n) is the number of ordered 6-factorizations of n.
references: T. M. Apostol, Introduction to Analytic Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, 1976, pages 29 and 38
Leveque, William J., Fundamentals of Number Theory. New York:Dover Publications, 1996, ISBN 9780486689067, p .167-Exercise 5.b.
links: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
E. Pérez Herrero, Piltz Divisor functions (1), Psychedelic Geometry Blogspot, Dec 21 2009
E. Pérez Herrero, Piltz Divisor functions (2), Psychedelic Geometry Blogspot, Dec 24 2009
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: zeta^6(s).Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (e+5 choose e). - _Mitch Harris_, Jun 27 2005The Piltz divisor functions hold for tau_j(*)tau_k = tau_{j+k}, where (*) means Dirichlet´s functional convolution.
mathematica: tau[n_, 1] = 1; tau[n_, k_] := tau[n, k] = Plus @@ (tau[ #, k - 1] & /@ Divisors[n]); Table[ tau[n, 6], {n, 68}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
prog: tmd(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = binomial(f[i,2] + 5, f[i,2]); f[i,2]=1); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 09 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 02 2005
